column1: Apply Clarvos branding to third-party payment (Stripe) integration
column29:
As a user, I want to securely make payments using credit/debit cards, bank transfers, and real-time payments, credit/debit cards, bank transfers, and real-time payments, so that my customers can securely make payments without leaving the platform, ensuring a smooth, seamless experience.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

# *Credit/Debit Card Payment:*
#* The system should display a Stripe-powered payment form that accepts major credit and debit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, etc.).
#* The payment form should validate card details (number, expiry date, CVV) before submission.
#* The system should securely transmit card details to Stripe using tokenization.
#* On successful payment, the customer should receive a confirmation message and email.
#* On failed payment, the customer should receive an appropriate error message and the ability to retry.
#** “The payment was unsuccessful due to [error], please try again”.
#* The payment status should be recorded in the order management system.
# *Bank Transfer Payment:*
#* The system should display the option for bank transfer using Stripe.
#* The user should be able to select their bank and initiate the transfer securely.
#* The system should handle domestic transfers 
#* On successful payment, the customer should receive a confirmation message and email.
#* On failed payment, the customer should receive an appropriate error message and the ability to retry.
#** “The payment was unsuccessful due to [error], please try again”.
#* The payment status should be recorded in the order management system.
# *Real-Time Payments (e.g., Stripe-supported instant payments):*
#* The system should display available real-time payment options (e.g., RTP, instant bank transfers).
#* The payment should be processed instantly and reflect immediately in the customer's account.
#* On successful payment, the customer should receive a confirmation message and email.
#** Message: “Payment was successful.  A confirmation receipt will be sent via email”
#** Email content (TBD)
#* On failed payment, the customer should receive an appropriate error message and the ability to retry.
#** “The payment was unsuccessful due to [error], please try again”.
#* The payment status should be recorded in the order management system.
# *General Requirements:*
#* Payment options should be in alignment with contract subscriptions.
#** 3, 6, 12-month options
#* Payment options should have ability for automatic renewal based on subscriptions.
#* All sensitive customer and financial data should be handled securely and in compliance. Including encryption.
#* Stripe webhooks should be implemented to update payment status in real-time.
#* Partial and full refunds should be supported through Stripe’s API. (Pending Legal)
#* Error handling and user-friendly messages should be provided for all failed transactions.
#* System logs should record all payment attempts, successes, and failures for auditing purposes.

----

There is a more advanced version, Stripe payment intents API, which may be more than we need. [~accountid:712020:7dec8aae-595f-49a8-a284-747b478eb26c]

column1: DAB Deployment

column29: [~accountid:712020:fd225af5-a3e9-4ade-9126-4b9c5994218e] has been working to improve and refine the data relevancy model by trialing different LLMs, adding additional columns, and tuning system prompts. After his successful evaluation procedure is performed, and we walk through the new logic changes, we will add the necessary components to the context area process.
column52: Evaluation procedure is understood and aligns with the requirements to improve this model, and is successfully implemented into the context area process. There is not an effective and scalable method to evaluate the context area, which is why Matt is evaluating on a sythetic dataset.

column1: Integrate Cluster Models

column1: Improved support for status on competitor product brands
column29: Competitor product brands are created without a status, which makes loading them from the /brand/{brandId} endpoint fail. We need to either create them with a ‘ready’ status, or adjust that endpoint to remove the status check for competitor product brands (since they don’t really have a status).

API: Request strategy generation from AI/Ops
column29: When the user clicks “Build Strategies” on the home page and calls `POST /strategy ` endpoint, we need that endpoint to trigger a request to AI/Ops, so that they can begin building the strategy.
column52:
* If the call to AI/Ops endpoint fails, we can just send a 500 Server Error response from our endpoint for now. The user can try again. We can probably omit retrying the request for now since there is an easy way to recover.
** If the request fails, the user should be left where they were on the Home Page in the UI, so that they can submit again.
* Only after the request to AI/Ops succeeds should we create the Strategy in our DB

Terraform for Auth0 Tenant, SPA, API, Roles & Permissions

Create IaC/Terraform for Auth0 resources. This allows us to ensure consistent resources (ex: Roles, Permissions) across environments.

This flow should also stage secrets for the Management API (or any other secrets) in Secret Manager for the backend to consume.
